Name: The Chaos Class
Credit: Dir: Ertem Egilmez With: Kemal Sunal, MÃ¼nir Ãzkul, Halit AkÃ§atepe
Outline: Lazy, uneducated students share a very close bond. They live together in the dormitory, where they plan their latest pranks. When a new headmaster arrives, the students naturally try to overthrow him. A comic war of nitwits follows.

Name: The Shawshank Redemption

Name: The Godfather

Name: Goodfellas

Name: My Father and My Son
Credit: Dir: Ãagan Irmak With: Fikret Kuskan, Ãetin Tekindor, HÃ¼meyra
Outline: Sadik is one of the rebellious youth who has been politically active as a university student and became a left-wing journalist in the 70's...

Name: Drishyam
Credit: Dir: Nishikant Kamat With: Ajay Devgn, Shriya Saran, Tabu
Outline: Desperate measures are taken by a man who tries to save his family from the dark side of the law, after they commit an unexpected crime.

Name: Seven Samurai
Credit: Dir: Akira Kurosawa With: ToshirÃ´ Mifune, Takashi Shimura, Keiko Tsushima
Outline: A poor village under attack by bandits recruits seven unemployed samurai to help them defend themselves.

Name: City of God
Credit: Dir: Fernando Meirelles, KÃ¡tia Lund With: Alexandre Rodrigues, Matheus Nachtergaele, Leandro Firmino

Name: It's a Wonderful Life

Name: Interstellar

Outline: Mathilda, a 12-year-old girl, is reluctantly taken in by LÃ©on, a professional assassin, after her family is murdered. LÃ©on and Mathilda form an unusual relationship, as she becomes his protÃ©gÃ©e and learns the assassin's trade.

Name: City Lights
Credit: Dir: Charles Chaplin With: Charles Chaplin, Virginia Cherrill, Florence Lee

Name: The Intouchables

Name: Saving Private Ryan

Name: Baahubali: The Beginning

Name: American History X

Name: Modern Times
Credit: Dir: Charles Chaplin With: Charles Chaplin, Paulette Goddard, Henry Bergman

Name: The Bandit
Credit: Dir: Yavuz Turgul With: Sener Sen, Ugur YÃ¼cel, Sermin HÃ¼rmeric

Name: The Green Mile

Name: Like Stars on Earth

Name: Sunset Blvd.

Name: The Prestige
Credit: Dir: Christopher Nolan With: Christian Bale, Hugh Jackman, Scarlett Johansson

Name: Cinema Paradiso

Name: Sholay

Name: The Lives of Others
Credit: Dir: Florian Henckel von Donnersmarck With: Ulrich MÃ¼he, Martina Gedeck, Sebastian Koch

Name: Grave of the Fireflies
Credit: Dir: Isao Takahata With: Tsutomu Tatsumi, Ayano Shiraishi, Akemi Yamaguchi

Name: Paths of Glory

Name: Witness for the Prosecution

Name: Das Boot
Credit: Dir: Wolfgang Petersen With: JÃ¼rgen Prochnow, Herbert GrÃ¶nemeyer, Klaus Wennemann

Name: M

Name: Queen

Name: A Separation

Name: Munna Bhai M.B.B.S.

Name: Braveheart
Credit: Dir: Mel Gibson With: Mel Gibson, Sophie Marceau, Patrick McGoohan

Name: Double Indemnity

Name: Rang De Basanti

Name: Requiem for a Dream

Name: A Clockwork Orange

Name: Chakde! India

Name: The Kid

Name: Eternal Sunshine of the Spotless Mind

Name: Sunrise

Name: Bhaag Milkha Bhaag

Name: Yojimbo
Credit: Dir: Akira Kurosawa With: ToshirÃ´ Mifune, EijirÃ´ TÃ´no, Tatsuya Nakadai

Name: All About Eve
Credit: Dir: Joseph L. Mankiewicz With: Bette Davis, Anne Baxter, George Sanders

Name: Full Metal Jacket

Name: Rashomon

Name: Gangs of Wasseypur

Name: The Apartment

Name: The Treasure of the Sierra Madre

Outline: Fred Dobbs and Bob Curtin, two Americans searching for work in Mexico, convince an old prospector to help them mine for gold in the Sierra Madre Mountains.

Name: Ikiru
Credit: Dir: Akira Kurosawa With: Takashi Shimura, Nobuo Kaneko, Shin'ichi Himori
Outline: A bureaucrat tries to find a meaning in his life after he discovers he has terminal cancer.

Name: Metropolis
Credit: Dir: Fritz Lang With: Brigitte Helm, Alfred Abel, Gustav FrÃ¶hlich
Outline: In a futuristic city sharply divided between the working class and the city planners, the son of the city's mastermind falls in love with a working class prophet who predicts the coming of a savior to mediate their differences.

Name: Inglourious Basterds

Name: Haider

Name: Scarface

Outline: In 1980 Miami, a determined Cuban immigrant takes over a drug cartel while succumbing to greed.

Name: OMG: Oh My God!
Credit: Dir: Umesh Shukla With: Paresh Rawal, Mithun Chakraborty, Akshay Kumar
Outline: A shopkeeper takes God to court when his shop is destroyed by an earthquake.

Name: Swades

Name: L.A. Confidential

Name: The Hunt

Name: Room

Name: Inside Out

Name: Dilwale Dulhania Le Jayenge

Name: PK

Name: Good Will Hunting

Name: Downfall

Name: Raging Bull

Name: Ran

Name: The Great Escape

Name: Mr. Smith Goes to Washington

Name: On the Waterfront
Credit: Dir: Elia Kazan With: Marlon Brando, Karl Malden, Lee J. Cobb
Outline: An ex-prize fighter turned longshoreman struggles to stand up to his corrupt union bosses.

Name: The Gold Rush

Name: The General

Name: Judgment at Nuremberg

Name: Kahaani

Name: Chinatown

Name: Wild Strawberries

Name: Solaris

Outline: A psychologist is sent to a station orbiting a distant planet in order to discover what has caused the crew to go insane.

Name: Mr. Nobody

Name: The Edge of Heaven

Name: Batman: Mask of the Phantasm

Name: Blue Is the Warmest Color

Name: The Motorcycle Diaries

Name: Evil

Name: The Day the Earth Stood Still

Name: Beasts of No Nation

Name: Apocalypto

Name: Guess Who's Coming to Dinner

Name: Birdman or (The Unexpected Virtue of Ignorance)

Name: The Fugitive

Name: The Game

Name: What's Eating Gilbert Grape

Name: Lucky Number Slevin

Slevin is under constant surveillance by relentless Detective Brikowski as well as the infamous assassin Goodkat and finds himself having to hatch his own ingenious plot to get them before they get him.

Name: Being John Malkovich

Name: Donnie Brasco

Name: Run Lola Run

Name: Pride

Name: Serpico

Name: The Sandlot

Name: Finding Neverland

Name: Creed

Name: Remember the Titans

Name: A Bronx Tale

Name: Argo

Name: Control

Name: Good Bye Lenin!

Name: Bad Education

Name: Babel
Credit: Dir: Alejandro G. IÃ±Ã¡rritu With: Brad Pitt, Cate Blanchett, Gael GarcÃ­a Bernal

Name: City Island

Name: The Cider House Rules
Credit: Dir: Lasse HallstrÃ¶m With: Tobey Maguire, Charlize Theron, Michael Caine
Outline: A compassionate young man, raised in an orphanage and trained to be a doctor there, decides to leave to see the world.

Name: Dirty Pretty Things
Credit: Dir: Stephen Frears With: Chiwetel Ejiofor, Audrey Tautou, Sophie Okonedo
Outline: An illegal Nigerian immigrant discovers the unpalatable side of London life.

Name: Starred Up
Credit: Dir: David Mackenzie With: Jack O'Connell, Ben Mendelsohn, Rupert Friend
Outline: Eric Love (O'Connell) is a 19 year old teenager who is so violent he has been 'Starred Up' (Moved to...

Name: Irreversible

Name: The Phantom of the Opera

Outline: A young soprano becomes the obsession of a disfigured musical genius who lives beneath the Paris OpÃ©ra House.

Name: Dead Ringers

Name: Memoirs of a Geisha
Credit: Dir: Rob Marshall With: Ziyi Zhang, Ken Watanabe, Michelle Yeoh
Outline: Nitta Sayuri reveals how she transcended her fishing-village roots and became one of Japan's most celebrated geisha.

Name: The Science of Sleep
Credit: Dir: Michel Gondry With: Gael GarcÃ­a Bernal, Charlotte Gainsbourg, Miou-Miou
Outline: A man entranced by his dreams and imagination is love-struck with a French woman and feels he can show her his world.

Name: Woman in Gold
Credit: Dir: Simon Curtis With: Helen Mirren, Ryan Reynolds, Daniel BrÃ¼hl
Outline: Maria Altmann, an octogenarian Jewish refugee, takes on the Austrian government to recover artwork she believes rightfully belongs to her family.

Name: Heathers
Credit: Dir: Michael Lehmann With: Winona Ryder, Christian Slater, Shannen Doherty
Outline: In order to get out of the snobby clique that is destroying her good-girl reputation, an intelligent teen teams up with a dark sociopath in a plot to kill the cool kids.

Name: Revolutionary Road
Credit: Dir: Sam Mendes With: Leonardo DiCaprio, Kate Winslet, Christopher Fitzgerald
Outline: A young couple living in a Connecticut suburb during the mid-1950s struggle to come to terms with their personal problems while trying to raise their two children.

Name: The Life Aquatic with Steve Zissou
Credit: Dir: Wes Anderson With: Bill Murray, Owen Wilson, Anjelica Huston
Outline: With a plan to exact revenge on a mythical shark that killed his partner, oceanographer Steve Zissou rallies a crew that includes his estranged wife, a journalist, and a man who may or may not be his son.

Name: Submarine
Credit: Dir: Richard Ayoade With: Craig Roberts, Sally Hawkins, Paddy Considine
Outline: 15-year-old Oliver Tate has two objectives: To lose his virginity before his next birthday, and to extinguish the flame between his mother and an ex-lover who has resurfaced in her life.

Name: Seabiscuit
Credit: Dir: Gary Ross With: Tobey Maguire, Jeff Bridges, Elizabeth Banks
Outline: True story of the undersized Depression-era racehorse whose victories lifted not only the spirits of the team behind it but also those of their nation.

Name: Carol
Credit: Dir: Todd Haynes With: Cate Blanchett, Rooney Mara, Sarah Paulson
Outline: An aspiring photographer develops an intimate relationship with an older woman.

Name: L'auberge espagnole
Credit: Dir: CÃ©dric Klapisch With: Romain Duris, Judith GodrÃ¨che, Kelly Reilly
Outline: A strait-laced French student moves into an apartment in Barcelona with a cast of six other characters from all over Europe. Together, they speak the international language of love and friendship.

Name: Ghajini
Credit: Dir: A.R. Murugadoss With: Aamir Khan, Asin, Jiah Khan
Outline: A short-term memory loss patient sets out on his journey to avenge the death of his beloved girl.

Name: Paris, je t'aime
Credit: Dir: Olivier Assayas, FrÃ©dÃ©ric Auburtin With: Juliette Binoche, Leonor Watling, Ludivine Sagnier
Outline: Through the neighborhoods of Paris, love is veiled, revealed, imitated, sucked dry, reinvented and awakened.

Name: Enter the Void
Credit: Dir: Gaspar NoÃ© With: Nathaniel Brown, Paz de la Huerta, Cyril Roy
Outline: A U.S. drug dealer living in Tokyo is betrayed by his best friend and killed in a drug deal. His soul, observing the repercussions of his death, seeks resurrection.

Name: The Young Victoria
Credit: Dir: Jean-Marc VallÃ©e With: Emily Blunt, Rupert Friend, Paul Bettany
Outline: A dramatization of the turbulent first years of Queen Victoria's rule, and her enduring romance with Prince Albert.

Name: Friday
Credit: Dir: F. Gary Gray With: Ice Cube, Chris Tucker, Nia Long
Outline: Two homies, Smokey and Craig, smoke a dope dealer's weed and try to figure a way to get the $200 they owe to the dealer by ten p.m. that same night. In that time, they smoke more weed, get jacked, and they get shot at in a drive-by.

Name: Gosford Park
Credit: Dir: Robert Altman With: Maggie Smith, Ryan Phillippe, Michael Gambon
Outline: The lives of upstairs guests and downstairs servants at a party in 1932 in a country house in England as they investigate a murder involving one of them.

Name: The Fountain
Credit: Dir: Darren Aronofsky With: Hugh Jackman, Rachel Weisz, Sean Patrick Thomas
Outline: As a modern-day scientist, Tommy is struggling with mortality, desperately searching for the medical breakthrough that will save the life of his cancer-stricken wife, Izzi.

Name: The Place Beyond the Pines
Credit: Dir: Derek Cianfrance With: Ryan Gosling, Bradley Cooper, Eva Mendes
Outline: A motorcycle stunt rider turns to robbing banks as a way to provide for his lover and their newborn child, a decision that puts him on a collision course with an ambitious rookie cop navigating a department ruled by a corrupt detective.

Name: American Sniper
Genre: Action | Biography | Drama | History | Thriller | War
Credit: Dir: Clint Eastwood With: Bradley Cooper, Sienna Miller, Kyle Gallner
Outline: Navy S.E.A.L. sniper Chris Kyle's pinpoint accuracy saves countless lives on the battlefield and turns him into a legend. Back home to his wife and kids after four tours of duty, however, Chris finds that it is the war he can't leave behind.

Name: Antwone Fisher
Credit: Dir: Denzel Washington With: Denzel Washington, Derek Luke, Joy Bryant
Outline: Antwone Fisher, a young navy man, is forced to see a psychiatrist after a violent outburst against a fellow crewman. During the course of treatment a painful past is revealed and a new hope begins.

Name: I Origins
Credit: Dir: Mike Cahill With: Michael Pitt, Steven Yeun, Astrid BergÃ¨s-Frisbey
Outline: A molecular biologist and his laboratory partner uncover evidence that may fundamentally change society as we know it.

Name: Sweet and Lowdown
Credit: Dir: Woody Allen With: Sean Penn, Samantha Morton, Woody Allen
Outline: In the 1930s, jazz guitarist Emmet Ray idolizes Django Reinhardt, faces gangsters and falls in love with a mute woman.

Name: This Boy's Life
Credit: Dir: Michael Caton-Jones With: Robert De Niro, Leonardo DiCaprio, Ellen Barkin
Outline: The story about the relationship between a rebellious 50s teenager and his abusive father, based on the memoirs of writer and literature professor Tobias Wolff.

Name: Eyes Wide Shut
Credit: Dir: Stanley Kubrick With: Tom Cruise, Nicole Kidman, Todd Field
Outline: A New York City doctor, who is married to an art curator, pushes himself on a harrowing and dangerous night-long odyssey of sexual and moral discovery after his wife admits that she once almost cheated on him.

Name: The Hundred-Foot Journey
Credit: Dir: Lasse HallstrÃ¶m With: Helen Mirren, Om Puri, Manish Dayal
Outline: The Kadam family leaves India for France where they open a restaurant directly across the road from Madame Mallory's Michelin-starred eatery.

Name: Caché
Credit: Dir: Michael Haneke With: Daniel Auteuil, Juliette Binoche, Maurice BÃ©nichou
Outline: A married couple is terrorized by a series of surveillance videotapes left on their front porch.

Name: The Girl Who Kicked the Hornet's Nest
Credit: Dir: Daniel Alfredson With: Michael Nyqvist, Noomi Rapace, Lena Endre
Outline: Lisbeth is recovering in a hospital and awaiting trial for three murders when she is released. Mikael must prove her innocence, but Lisbeth must be willing to share the details of her sordid experiences with the court.

Name: The Terminal
Credit: Dir: Steven Spielberg With: Tom Hanks, Catherine Zeta-Jones, Chi McBride
Outline: An eastern immigrant finds himself stranded in JFK airport, and must take up temporary residence there.

Name: Murder on the Orient Express
Credit: Dir: Sidney Lumet With: Albert Finney, Lauren Bacall, Ingrid Bergman
Outline: In 1935, when his train is stopped by deep snow, detective Hercule Poirot is called on to solve a murder that occurred in his car the night before.

Name: The Crying Game
Credit: Dir: Neil Jordan With: Stephen Rea, Jaye Davidson, Forest Whitaker
Outline: A British soldier is kidnapped by IRA terrorists. He befriends one of his captors, who is drawn into the soldier's world.

Name: Flight
Credit: Dir: Robert Zemeckis With: Denzel Washington, Nadine Velazquez, Don Cheadle
Outline: An airline pilot saves almost all his passengers on his malfunctioning airliner which eventually crashed, but an investigation into the accident reveals something troubling.

Name: Force Majeure
Credit: Dir: Ruben Ãstlund With: Johannes Kuhnke, Lisa Loven Kongsli, Clara Wettergren
Outline: A family on a ski holiday in the French Alps find themselves staring down an avalanche during lunch one day; in the aftermath, their dynamic has been shaken to its core, with a question mark hanging over their patriarch in particular.

Name: The Basketball Diaries
Credit: Dir: Scott Kalvert With: Leonardo DiCaprio, Lorraine Bracco, Marilyn Sokol
Outline: A teenager finds his dreams of becoming a basketball star threatened after he free falls into the harrowing world of drug addiction.

Name: Finding Forrester
Credit: Dir: Gus Van Sant With: Sean Connery, Rob Brown, F. Murray Abraham
Outline: A young writing prodigy finds a mentor in a reclusive author.

Name: Good Morning, Vietnam
Credit: Dir: Barry Levinson With: Robin Williams, Forest Whitaker, Tung Thanh Tran
Outline: An unorthodox and irreverent DJ begins to shake up things when he is assigned to the US Armed Services Radio station in Vietnam.

Name: Frailty
Credit: Dir: Bill Paxton With: Bill Paxton, Matthew McConaughey, Powers Boothe
Outline: A man confesses to an FBI agent his family's story of how his religious fanatic father's visions lead to a series of murders to destroy supposed "demons."

Name: The People vs. Larry Flynt
Credit: Dir: Milos Forman With: Woody Harrelson, Courtney Love, Edward Norton
Outline: A partially idealized film of the controversial pornography publisher and how he became a defender of free speech for all people.

Name: Closer
Credit: Dir: Mike Nichols With: Natalie Portman, Jude Law, Clive Owen
Outline: The relationships of two couples become complicated and deceitful when the man from one couple meets the woman of the other.

Name: The Secret Garden
Credit: Dir: Agnieszka Holland With: Kate Maberly, Maggie Smith, Heydon Prowse
Outline: A young British girl born and raised in India loses her neglectful parents in an earthquake. She is returned to England to live at her uncle's estate...

Name: Beasts of the Southern Wild
Credit: Dir: Benh Zeitlin With: QuvenzhanÃ© Wallis, Dwight Henry, Levy Easterly
Outline: Faced with both her hot-tempered father's fading health and melting ice-caps that flood her ramshackle bayou community and unleash ancient aurochs, six-year-old Hushpuppy must learn the ways of courage and love.

Name: Matchstick Men
Credit: Dir: Ridley Scott With: Nicolas Cage, Alison Lohman, Sam Rockwell
Outline: A phobic con artist and his protÃ©gÃ© are on the verge of pulling off a lucrative swindle when the former's teenage daughter arrives unexpectedly.

Name: Thirteen Days
Credit: Dir: Roger Donaldson With: Kevin Costner, Bruce Greenwood, Shawn Driscoll
Outline: A dramatization of the Kennedy administration's struggle to contain the Cuban Missile Crisis in October 1962.

Name: Animal Kingdom
Credit: Dir: David MichÃ´d With: James Frecheville, Guy Pearce, Joel Edgerton
Outline: A seventeen year-old navigates his survival amongst an explosive criminal family and the detective who thinks he can save him.

Name: Candy
Credit: Dir: Neil Armfield With: Heath Ledger, Abbie Cornish, Geoffrey Rush
Outline: A poet falls in love with an art student who gravitates to his bohemian lifestyle -- and his love of heroin. Hooked as much on one another as they are on the drug, their relationship alternates between states of oblivion, self-destruction, and despair.

Name: Only Lovers Left Alive
Credit: Dir: Jim Jarmusch With: Tilda Swinton, Tom Hiddleston, Mia Wasikowska
Outline: A depressed musician reunites with his lover, though their romance - which has already endured several centuries - is disrupted by the arrival of her uncontrollable younger sister.

Name: Punch-Drunk Love
Credit: Dir: Paul Thomas Anderson With: Adam Sandler, Emily Watson, Philip Seymour Hoffman
Outline: A psychologically troubled novelty supplier is nudged towards a romance with an English woman, all the while being extorted by a phone-sex line run by a crooked mattress salesman, and purchasing stunning amounts of pudding.

Name: An Education
Credit: Dir: Lone Scherfig With: Carey Mulligan, Peter Sarsgaard, Alfred Molina
Outline: A coming-of-age story about a teenage girl in 1960s suburban London, and how her life changes with the arrival of a playboy nearly twice her age.

Name: Blue Jasmine
Credit: Dir: Woody Allen With: Cate Blanchett, Alec Baldwin, Peter Sarsgaard
Outline: A New York socialite, deeply troubled and in denial, arrives in San Francisco to impose upon her sister. She looks a million, but isn't bringing money, peace, or love...

Name: Fish Tank
Credit: Dir: Andrea Arnold With: Katie Jarvis, Michael Fassbender, Kierston Wareing
Outline: Everything changes for 15-year-old Mia when her mum brings home a new boyfriend.

Name: Monster
Credit: Dir: Patty Jenkins With: Charlize Theron, Christina Ricci, Bruce Dern
Outline: Based on the life of Aileen Wuornos, a Daytona Beach prostitute who became a serial killer.

Name: Michael Clayton
Credit: Dir: Tony Gilroy With: George Clooney, Tilda Swinton, Tom Wilkinson
Outline: A law firm brings in its "fixer" to remedy the situation after a lawyer has a breakdown while representing a chemical company that he knows is guilty in a multi-billion dollar class action suit.

Name: Four Lions
Credit: Dir: Christopher Morris With: Will Adamsdale, Riz Ahmed, Adeel Akhtar
Outline: Four incompetent British jihadists set out to train for and commit an act of terror.

Name: The Great Gatsby
Credit: Dir: Baz Luhrmann With: Leonardo DiCaprio, Carey Mulligan, Joel Edgerton
Outline: A writer and wall street trader, Nick, finds himself drawn to the past and lifestyle of his millionaire neighbor, Jay Gatsby.

Name: American Hustle
Credit: Dir: David O. Russell With: Christian Bale, Amy Adams, Bradley Cooper
Outline: A con man, Irving Rosenfeld, along with his seductive partner Sydney Prosser, is forced to work for a wild FBI agent, Richie DiMaso, who pushes them into a world of Jersey powerbrokers and mafia.

Name: Chocolat
Credit: Dir: Lasse HallstrÃ¶m With: Juliette Binoche, Judi Dench, Alfred Molina
Outline: A woman and her daughter open a chocolate shop in a small French village that shakes up the rigid morality of the community.

Name: Talaash
Credit: Dir: Reema Kagti With: Aamir Khan, Kareena Kapoor, Rani Mukerji
Outline: Inspector Surjan Shekawat who is dealing with a depressing past has to investigate a high profile murder case where in he finds solace in a prostitute by the name of Rosie.

Name: Stuck in Love
Credit: Dir: Josh Boone With: Greg Kinnear, Jennifer Connelly, Lily Collins
Outline: An acclaimed writer, his ex-wife, and their teenaged children come to terms with the complexities of love in all its forms over the course of one tumultuous year.

Name: Before the Devil Knows You're Dead
Credit: Dir: Sidney Lumet With: Philip Seymour Hoffman, Ethan Hawke, Albert Finney
Outline: When two brothers organize the robbery of their parents' jewelry store the job goes horribly wrong, triggering a series of events that sends them, their father and one brother's wife hurtling towards a shattering climax.

Name: Crimson Tide
Credit: Dir: Tony Scott With: Gene Hackman, Denzel Washington, Matt Craven
Outline: On a US nuclear missile sub, a young first officer stages a mutiny to prevent his trigger happy captain from launching his missiles before confirming his orders to do so.

Name: Mr. Holland's Opus
Credit: Dir: Stephen Herek With: Richard Dreyfuss, Glenne Headly, Jay Thomas
Outline: A frustrated composer finds fulfillment as a high school music teacher.

Name: Hard Eight
Credit: Dir: Paul Thomas Anderson With: Philip Baker Hall, John C. Reilly, Gwyneth Paltrow
Outline: Professional gambler Sydney teaches John the tricks of the trade. John does well until he falls for cocktail waitress Clementine.

Name: Mongol: The Rise of Genghis Khan
Credit: Dir: Sergey Bodrov With: Tadanobu Asano, Amadu Mamadakov, Khulan Chuluun
Outline: The story recounts the early life of Genghis Khan who was a slave before going on to conquer half the world including Russia in 1206.

Name: Crazy Heart
Credit: Dir: Scott Cooper With: Jeff Bridges, Maggie Gyllenhaal, Colin Farrell
Outline: A faded country music musician is forced to reassess his dysfunctional life during a doomed romance that also inspires him.

Name: Election
Credit: Dir: Alexander Payne With: Matthew Broderick, Reese Witherspoon, Chris Klein
Outline: A high school teacher's personal life becomes complicated as he works with students during the school elections, particularly with an obsessive overachiever determined to become student body president.

Name: Erin Brockovich
Credit: Dir: Steven Soderbergh With: Julia Roberts, Albert Finney, David Brisbin
Outline: An unemployed single mother becomes a legal assistant and almost single-handedly brings down a California power company accused of polluting a city's water supply.

Name: The Negotiator
Credit: Dir: F. Gary Gray With: Samuel L. Jackson, Kevin Spacey, David Morse
Outline: In a desperate attempt to prove his innocence, a skilled police negotiator accused of corruption and murder takes hostages in a government office to gain the time he needs to find the truth.

Name: Natural Born Killers
Credit: Dir: Oliver Stone With: Woody Harrelson, Juliette Lewis, Tom Sizemore
Outline: Two victims of traumatized childhoods become lovers and psychopathic serial murderers irresponsibly glorified by the mass media.

Name: Big
Credit: Dir: Penny Marshall With: Tom Hanks, Elizabeth Perkins, Robert Loggia
Outline: When a boy wishes to be big at a magic wish machine, he wakes up the next morning and finds himself in an adult body.

Name: Lawless
Credit: Dir: John Hillcoat With: Tom Hardy, Shia LaBeouf, Guy Pearce
Outline: Set in Depression-era Franklin County, Virginia, a trio of bootlegging brothers are threatened by a new special deputy and other authorities angling for a cut of their profits.

Name: Steve Jobs
Credit: Dir: Danny Boyle With: Michael Fassbender, Kate Winslet, Seth Rogen
Outline: Steve Jobs takes us behind the scenes of the digital revolution, to paint a portrait of the man at its epicenter. The story unfolds backstage at three iconic product launches, ending in 1998 with the unveiling of the iMac.

Name: The Fox and the Hound
Credit: Dir: Ted Berman, Richard Rich With: Mickey Rooney, Kurt Russell, Pearl Bailey
Outline: Two childhood friends find themselves forced to become enemies.

Name: Jerry Maguire
Credit: Dir: Cameron Crowe With: Tom Cruise, Cuba Gooding Jr., RenÃ©e Zellweger
Outline: When a sports agent has a moral epiphany and is fired for expressing it, he decides to put his new philosophy to the test as an independent with the only athlete who stays with him.

Name: Soul Kitchen
Credit: Dir: Fatih Akin With: Adam Bousdoukos, Moritz Bleibtreu, Pheline Roggan
Outline: In Hamburg, German-Greek chef Zinos unknowingly disturbs the peace in his locals-only restaurant by hiring a more talented chef.

Name: Chef
Credit: Dir: Jon Favreau With: Jon Favreau, Robert Downey Jr., Scarlett Johansson
Outline: A chef who loses his restaurant job starts up a food truck in an effort to reclaim his creative promise, while piecing back together his estranged family.

Name: Mean Creek
Credit: Dir: Jacob Aaron Estes With: Rory Culkin, Ryan Kelley, Scott Mechlowicz
Outline: When a teen is bullied, his brother and friends lure the bully into the woods to seek revenge.

Name: A Tale of Two Sisters
Credit: Dir: Jee-woon Kim With: Kap-su Kim, Jung-ah Yum, Su-jeong Lim
Outline: A family is haunted by the tragedies of deaths within the family.

Name: Dope
Credit: Dir: Rick Famuyiwa With: Shameik Moore, Tony Revolori, Kiersey Clemons
Outline: Life changes for Malcolm, a geek who's surviving life in a tough neighborhood, after a chance invitation to an underground party leads him and his friends into a Los Angeles adventure.

Name: Little Women
Credit: Dir: Gillian Armstrong With: Susan Sarandon, Winona Ryder, Kirsten Dunst
Outline: The March sisters live and grow in post-Civil War America.

Name: Enemy of the State
Credit: Dir: Tony Scott With: Will Smith, Gene Hackman, Jon Voight
Outline: A lawyer becomes a target by a corrupt politician and his NSA goons when he accidentally receives key evidence to a serious politically motivated crime.

Name: The Best Exotic Marigold Hotel
Credit: Dir: John Madden With: Judi Dench, Bill Nighy, Maggie Smith
Outline: British retirees travel to India to take up residence in what they believe is a newly restored hotel. Less luxurious than advertised, the Marigold Hotel nevertheless slowly begins to charm in unexpected ways.

Name: St. Vincent
Credit: Dir: Theodore Melfi With: Bill Murray, Melissa McCarthy, Naomi Watts
Outline: A young boy whose parents have just divorced finds an unlikely friend and mentor in the misanthropic, bawdy, hedonistic war veteran who lives next door.

Name: A River Runs Through It
Credit: Dir: Robert Redford With: Craig Sheffer, Brad Pitt, Tom Skerritt
Outline: The story about two sons of a stern minister -- one reserved, one rebellious -- growing up in rural Montana while devoted to fly fishing.

Name: The Bank Job
Credit: Dir: Roger Donaldson With: Jason Statham, Saffron Burrows, Stephen Campbell Moore
Outline: Martine offers Terry a lead on a foolproof bank hit on London's Baker Street. She targets a roomful of safe deposit boxes worth millions in cash and jewelry. But Terry and his crew don't realize the boxes also contain a treasure trove of dirty secrets - secrets that will thrust them into a deadly web of corruption and illicit scandal.

Name: North Country
Credit: Dir: Niki Caro With: Charlize Theron, Jeremy Renner, Frances McDormand
Outline: A fictionalized account of the first major successful sexual harassment case in the United States -- Jenson vs. Eveleth Mines, where a woman who endured a range of abuse while working as a miner filed and won the landmark 1984 lawsuit.

Name: Friday Night Lights
Credit: Dir: Peter Berg With: Billy Bob Thornton, Jay Hernandez, Derek Luke
Outline: Based on H.G. Bissinger's book, which profiled the economically depressed town of Odessa, Texas and their heroic high school football team, The Permian High Panthers.

Name: The Road
Credit: Dir: John Hillcoat With: Viggo Mortensen, Charlize Theron, Kodi Smit-McPhee
Outline: In a dangerous post-apocalyptic world, an ailing father defends his son as they slowly travel to the sea.

Name: The Hunger Games
Credit: Dir: Gary Ross With: Jennifer Lawrence, Josh Hutcherson, Liam Hemsworth
Outline: Katniss Everdeen voluntarily takes her younger sister's place in the Hunger Games, a televised competition in which two teenagers from each of the twelve Districts of Panem are chosen at random to fight to the death.

Name: August: Osage County
Credit: Dir: John Wells With: Meryl Streep, Dermot Mulroney, Julia Roberts
Outline: A look at the lives of the strong-willed women of the Weston family, whose paths have diverged until a family crisis brings them back to the Oklahoma house they grew up in, and to the dysfunctional woman who raised them.

Name: Shame
Credit: Dir: Steve McQueen With: Michael Fassbender, Carey Mulligan, James Badge Dale
Outline: In New York City, Brandon's carefully cultivated private life -- which allows him to indulge his sexual addiction -- is disrupted when his sister arrives unannounced for an indefinite stay.

Name: Fahrenheit 451
Credit: Dir: FranÃ§ois Truffaut With: Oskar Werner, Julie Christie, Cyril Cusack
Outline: In an oppressive future, a fireman whose duty is to destroy all books begins to question his task.

Name: Willow
Credit: Dir: Ron Howard With: Val Kilmer, Joanne Whalley, Warwick Davis
Outline: A reluctant dwarf must play a critical role in protecting a special baby from an evil queen.

Name: Half Nelson
Credit: Dir: Ryan Fleck With: Ryan Gosling, Anthony Mackie, Shareeka Epps
Outline: An inner-city junior high school teacher with a drug habit forms an unlikely friendship with one of his students after she discovers his secret.

Name: Chariots of Fire
Credit: Dir: Hugh Hudson With: Ben Cross, Ian Charleson, Nicholas Farrell
Outline: Two British track athletes, one a determined Jew and the other a devout Christian, compete in the 1924 Olympics.

Name: Dogtooth
Credit: Dir: Yorgos Lanthimos With: Christos Stergioglou, Michele Valley, Angeliki Papoulia
Outline: Three teenagers live isolated, without leaving their house, because their over-protective parents say they can only leave when their dogtooth falls out.

Name: The Believer
Credit: Dir: Henry Bean With: Ryan Gosling, Summer Phoenix, Peter Meadows
Outline: A young Jewish man develops a fiercely anti-Semitic philosophy. Based on the factual story of a K.K.K. member in the 1960s who was revealed to be Jewish by a New York Times reporter.

Name: The Woodsman
Credit: Dir: Nicole Kassell With: Kevin Bacon, Kyra Sedgwick, Yasiin Bey
Outline: A child molester returns to his hometown after 12 years in prison and attempts to start a new life.

Name: Amistad
Credit: Dir: Steven Spielberg With: Djimon Hounsou, Matthew McConaughey, Anthony Hopkins
Outline: About a 1839 mutiny aboard a slave ship that is traveling towards the northeastern coast of America. Much of the story involves a court-room drama about the free man who led the revolt.

Name: King Kong
Credit: Dir: Peter Jackson With: Naomi Watts, Jack Black, Adrien Brody
Outline: In 1933 New York, an overly ambitious movie producer coerces his cast and hired ship crew to travel to mysterious Skull Island, where they encounter Kong, a giant ape who is immediately smitten with leading lady Ann Darrow.

Name: Conviction
Credit: Dir: Tony Goldwyn With: Hilary Swank, Sam Rockwell, Melissa Leo
Outline: A working mother puts herself through law school in an effort to represent her brother, who has been wrongfully convicted of murder and has exhausted his chances to appeal his conviction through public defenders.

Name: Cashback
Credit: Dir: Sean Ellis With: Sean Biggerstaff, Emilia Fox, Michelle Ryan
Outline: After a painful breakup, Ben develops insomnia. To kill time, he starts working the late night shift at the local supermarket, where his artistic imagination runs wild.

Name: War Horse
Credit: Dir: Steven Spielberg With: Jeremy Irvine, Emily Watson, David Thewlis
Outline: Young Albert enlists to serve in World War I after his beloved horse is sold to the cavalry. Albert's hopeful journey takes him out of England and to the front lines as the war rages on.

Name: The Age of Adaline
Credit: Dir: Lee Toland Krieger With: Blake Lively, Michiel Huisman, Harrison Ford
Outline: A young woman, born at the turn of the 20th century, is rendered ageless after an accident. After many solitary years, she meets a man who complicates the eternal life she has settled into.

Name: Broken Embraces
Credit: Dir: Pedro AlmodÃ³var With: PenÃ©lope Cruz, LluÃ­s Homar, Blanca Portillo
Outline: Harry Caine, a blind writer, reaches this moment in time when he has to heal his wounds from 14 years back. He was then still known by his real name, Mateo Blanco, and directing his last movie.

Name: Adam
Credit: Dir: Max Mayer With: Hugh Dancy, Rose Byrne, Peter Gallagher
Outline: Adam, a lonely man with Asperger's Syndrome, develops a relationship with his upstairs neighbor, Beth.

Name: Coach Carter
Credit: Dir: Thomas Carter With: Samuel L. Jackson, Rick Gonzalez, Robert Ri'chard
Outline: Controversy surrounds high school basketball coach Ken Carter after he benches his entire team for breaking their academic contract with him.

Name: Red Dragon
Credit: Dir: Brett Ratner With: Anthony Hopkins, Edward Norton, Ralph Fiennes
Outline: A retired FBI agent with psychological gifts is assigned to help track down "The Tooth Fairy", a mysterious serial killer; aiding him is imprisoned criminal genius Hannibal "The Cannibal" Lecter.

Name: The Darjeeling Limited
Credit: Dir: Wes Anderson With: Owen Wilson, Adrien Brody, Jason Schwartzman
Outline: A year after their father's funeral, three brothers travel across India by train in an attempt to bond with each other.

Name: Audition
Credit: Dir: Takashi Miike With: Ryo Ishibashi, Eihi Shiina, Tetsu Sawaki
Outline: A widower takes an offer to screen girls at a special audition, arranged for him by a friend to find him a new wife. The one he fancies is not who she appears to be after all.

Name: The Virgin Suicides
Credit: Dir: Sofia Coppola With: Kirsten Dunst, Josh Hartnett, James Woods
Outline: A group of male friends become obsessed with five mysterious sisters who are sheltered by their strict, religious parents.

Name: If Only
Credit: Dir: Gil Junger With: Jennifer Love Hewitt, Paul Nicholls, Tom Wilkinson
Outline: It takes a tragedy to teach the young businessman Ian to put love ahead of work and open up to his musician girlfriend Samantha.

Name: The Sessions
Credit: Dir: Ben Lewin With: John Hawkes, Helen Hunt, William H. Macy
Outline: A man in an iron lung who wishes to lose his virginity contacts a professional sex surrogate with the help of his therapist and priest.

Name: Nothing But the Truth
Credit: Dir: Rod Lurie With: Kate Beckinsale, Matt Dillon, Vera Farmiga
Outline: In Washington, D.C., a female reporter faces a possible jail sentence for outing a CIA agent and refusing to reveal her source.

Name: Harry Brown
Credit: Dir: Daniel Barber With: Michael Caine, Emily Mortimer, David Bradley
Outline: An elderly ex-serviceman and widower looks to avenge his best friend's murder by doling out his own form of justice.

Name: Elephant
Credit: Dir: Gus Van Sant With: Elias McConnell, Alex Frost, Eric Deulen
Outline: Several ordinary high school students go through their daily routine as two others prepare for something more malevolent.

Name: The Age of Innocence
Credit: Dir: Martin Scorsese With: Daniel Day-Lewis, Michelle Pfeiffer, Winona Ryder
Outline: A tale of nineteenth-century New York high society in which a young lawyer falls in love with a woman separated from her husband, while he is engaged to the woman's cousin.

Name: In the Line of Fire
Credit: Dir: Wolfgang Petersen With: Clint Eastwood, John Malkovich, Rene Russo
Outline: Secret Service agent Frank Horrigan couldn't save Kennedy, but he's determined not to let a clever assassin take out this president.

Name: Narc
Credit: Dir: Joe Carnahan With: Ray Liotta, Jason Patric, Chi McBride
Outline: When the trail goes cold on a murder investigation of a policeman an undercover narcotics officer is lured back to the force to help solve the case.

Name: Benny & Joon
Credit: Dir: Jeremiah S. Chechik With: Johnny Depp, Mary Stuart Masterson, Aidan Quinn
Outline: A mentally ill young woman finds her love in an eccentric man who models himself after Buster Keaton.

Credit: Dir: Greg Marcks With: Henry Thomas, Colin Hanks, Ben Foster
Outline: The events leading up to an 11:14 PM car crash, from five very different perspectives.

Name: Shattered Glass
Credit: Dir: Billy Ray With: Hayden Christensen, ChloÃ« Sevigny, Steve Zahn
Outline: The true story of a young journalist who fell from grace when it was found he had fabricated over half of his articles.

Name: Chopper
Credit: Dir: Andrew Dominik With: Eric Bana, Simon Lyndon, David Field
Outline: Chopper tells the intense story of Mark "Chopper" Read, a legendary criminal who wrote his autobiography while serving a jail sentence in prison. His book, "From the Inside", upon which the film is based, was a best-seller.

Name: Arlington Road
Credit: Dir: Mark Pellington With: Jeff Bridges, Tim Robbins, Joan Cusack
Outline: A man begins to suspect his neighbors are not what they appear to be and their secrets could be deadly.

Name: Beautiful Girls
Credit: Dir: Ted Demme With: Matt Dillon, Timothy Hutton, Noah Emmerich
Outline: A piano player at a crossroads in his life returns home to his friends and their own problems with life and love.

Name: Fracture
Credit: Dir: Gregory Hoblit With: Anthony Hopkins, Ryan Gosling, David Strathairn
Outline: An attorney, intent on climbing the career ladder toward success, finds an unlikely opponent in a manipulative criminal he is trying to prosecute.

Name: Unbreakable
Credit: Dir: M. Night Shyamalan With: Bruce Willis, Samuel L. Jackson, Robin Wright
Outline: A man learns something extraordinary about himself after a devastating accident.

Name: Fast Times at Ridgemont High
Credit: Dir: Amy Heckerling With: Sean Penn, Jennifer Jason Leigh, Judge Reinhold
Outline: A group of Southern California high school students are enjoying their most important subjects: sex, drugs and rock n' roll.

Name: Glory Road
Credit: Dir: James Gartner With: Josh Lucas, Derek Luke, Austin Nichols
Outline: In 1966, Texas Western coach Don Haskins led the first all-black starting line-up for a college basketball team to the NCAA national championship.

Name: 10 Things I Hate About You

Outline: A new kid must find a guy to date the meanest girl in school, the older sister of the girl he has a crush on, who cannot date until her older sister does.

Name: Kingdom of Heaven
Credit: Dir: Ridley Scott With: Orlando Bloom, Eva Green, Liam Neeson
Outline: Balian of Ibelin travels to Jerusalem during the crusades of the 12th century, and there he finds himself as the defender of the city and its people.

Name: Winter's Bone
Credit: Dir: Debra Granik With: Jennifer Lawrence, John Hawkes, Garret Dillahunt
Outline: An unflinching Ozark Mountain girl hacks through dangerous social terrain as she hunts down her drug-dealing father while trying to keep her family intact.

Name: Sex and Lucia
Credit: Dir: Julio Medem With: Paz Vega, TristÃ¡n Ulloa, Najwa Nimri
Outline: Various lives converge on an isolated island, all connected by an author whose novel has become inextricably entwined with his own life.

Name: Marnie
Credit: Dir: Alfred Hitchcock With: Tippi Hedren, Sean Connery, Martin Gabel
Outline: Mark marries Marnie although she is a habitual thief and has serious psychological problems, and tries to help her confront and resolve them.

Name: The Doors
Credit: Dir: Oliver Stone With: Val Kilmer, Meg Ryan, Kyle MacLachlan
Outline: The story of the famous and influential 1960s rock band and its lead singer and composer, Jim Morrison, from his days as a UCLA film student in Los Angeles, to his untimely death in Paris, France at age 27 in 1971.

Name: Cold Mountain
Credit: Dir: Anthony Minghella With: Jude Law, Nicole Kidman, RenÃ©e Zellweger
Outline: In the waning days of the American Civil War, a wounded soldier embarks on a perilous journey back home to Cold Mountain, North Carolina to reunite with his sweetheart.

Name: Che: Part One
Credit: Dir: Steven Soderbergh With: Julia Ormond, Benicio Del Toro, Oscar Isaac
Outline: In 1956, Ernesto 'Che' Guevara and a band of Castro-led Cuban exiles mobilize an army to topple the regime of dictator Fulgencio Batista.

Name: Beginners
Credit: Dir: Mike Mills With: Ewan McGregor, Christopher Plummer, MÃ©lanie Laurent
Outline: A young man is rocked by two announcements from his elderly father: that he has terminal cancer, and that he has a young male lover.

Name: Broken Flowers
Credit: Dir: Jim Jarmusch With: Bill Murray, Jessica Lange, Sharon Stone
Outline: As the extremely withdrawn Don Johnston is dumped by his latest woman, he receives an anonymous letter from a former lover informing him that he has a son who may be looking for him. A freelance sleuth neighbor moves Don to embark on a cross-country search for his old flames in search of answers.

Name: Sex, Lies, and Videotape
Credit: Dir: Steven Soderbergh With: James Spader, Andie MacDowell, Peter Gallagher
Outline: A sexually repressed woman's husband is having an affair with her sister. The arrival of a visitor with a rather unusual fetish changes everything.

Name: Forgetting Sarah Marshall
Credit: Dir: Nicholas Stoller With: Kristen Bell, Jason Segel, Paul Rudd
Outline: Devastated Peter takes a Hawaiian vacation in order to deal with the recent break-up with his TV star girlfriend, Sarah. Little does he know, Sarah's traveling to the same resort as her ex - and she's bringing along her new boyfriend.

Credit: Dir: Michael Radford With: John Hurt, Richard Burton, Suzanna Hamilton
Outline: George Orwell's novel of a totalitarian future society in which a man whose daily work is rewriting history tries to rebel by falling in love.

Name: Steel Magnolias
Credit: Dir: Herbert Ross With: Shirley MacLaine, Olympia Dukakis, Sally Field
Outline: A young beautician, newly arrived in a small Louisiana town, finds work at the local salon, where a small group of women share a close bond of friendship and welcome her into the fold.

Name: In the Valley of Elah
Credit: Dir: Paul Haggis With: Tommy Lee Jones, Charlize Theron, Jonathan Tucker
Outline: A retired military investigator works with a police detective to uncover the truth behind his son's disappearance following his return from a tour of duty in Iraq.

Name: Rocky Balboa
Credit: Dir: Sylvester Stallone With: Sylvester Stallone, Antonio Tarver, Milo Ventimiglia
Outline: Thirty years after the ring of the first bell, Rocky Balboa comes out of retirement and dons his gloves for his final fight; against the reigning heavyweight champ Mason 'The Line' Dixon.

Name: Out of Africa
Credit: Dir: Sydney Pollack With: Meryl Streep, Robert Redford, Klaus Maria Brandauer
Outline: In 20th-century colonial Kenya, a Danish baroness/plantation owner has a passionate love affair with a free-spirited big-game hunter.

Name: The Dreamers
Credit: Dir: Bernardo Bertolucci With: Michael Pitt, Louis Garrel, Eva Green
Outline: A young American studying in Paris in 1968 strikes up a friendship with a French brother and sister. Set against the background of the '68 Paris student riots.

Name: Silverado
Credit: Dir: Lawrence Kasdan With: Kevin Kline, Scott Glenn, Kevin Costner
Outline: A misfit bunch of friends come together to right the injustices which exist in a small town.

Name: Now Is Good
Credit: Dir: Ol Parker With: Dakota Fanning, Josef Altin, Jeremy Irvine
Outline: A girl dying of leukemia compiles a list of things she'd like to do before passing away. Topping the list is her desire to lose her virginity.

Name: Agora
Credit: Dir: Alejandro AmenÃ¡bar With: Rachel Weisz, Max Minghella, Oscar Isaac
Outline: A historical drama set in Roman Egypt, concerning a slave who turns to the rising tide of Christianity in the hope of pursuing freedom while falling in love with his mistress, the famous philosophy and mathematics professor Hypatia of Alexandria.

Name: Ruby Sparks
Credit: Dir: Jonathan Dayton, Valerie Faris With: Paul Dano, Zoe Kazan, Annette Bening
Outline: A novelist struggling with writer's block finds romance in a most unusual way: by creating a female character he thinks will love him, then willing her into existence.

Name: JCVD
Credit: Dir: Mabrouk El Mechri With: Jean-Claude Van Damme, ValÃ©rie Bodson, HervÃ© Sogne
Outline: Jean-Claude Van Damme gets involved in a bank robbery with hostages situation and reflects about his life during it.

Name: Defiance

Outline: Jewish brothers in Nazi-occupied Eastern Europe escape into the Belarussian forests, where they join Russian resistance fighters and endeavor to build a village in order to protect themselves and about 1,000 Jewish non-combatants.

Name: Bridge to Terabithia
Credit: Dir: Gabor Csupo With: Josh Hutcherson, AnnaSophia Robb, Zooey Deschanel
Outline: A preteen's life turns upside down when he befriends the new girl in school and they imagine a whole new fantasy world to escape reality.

Name: Twin Peaks: Fire Walk with Me
Credit: Dir: David Lynch With: Sheryl Lee, Ray Wise, MÃ¤dchen Amick
Outline: A young FBI agent disappears while investigating a murder miles from Twin Peaks that may be related to the future murder of Laura Palmer; the last week of the life of Laura Palmer is chronicled.

Name: Muriel's Wedding
Credit: Dir: P.J. Hogan With: Toni Collette, Rachel Griffiths, Bill Hunter
Outline: Muriel finds life in Porpoise Spit, Australia dull and spends her days alone in her room listening to Abba music and dreaming of her wedding day...

Name: The Big Chill
Credit: Dir: Lawrence Kasdan With: Tom Berenger, Glenn Close, Jeff Goldblum
Outline: A group of seven former college friends gather for a weekend reunion at a South Carolina winter house after the funeral of one of their friends.

Name: The Karate Kid
Credit: Dir: John G. Avildsen With: Ralph Macchio, Pat Morita, Elisabeth Shue
Outline: A handyman/martial arts master agrees to teach a bullied boy karate and shows him that there is more to the martial art than fighting.

Name: Insomnia
Credit: Dir: Christopher Nolan With: Al Pacino, Robin Williams, Hilary Swank
Outline: Two Los Angeles homicide detectives are dispatched to a northern town where the sun doesn't set to investigate the methodical murder of a local teen.

Name: The Salton Sea
Credit: Dir: D.J. Caruso With: Val Kilmer, Vincent D'Onofrio, Adam Goldberg
Outline: After his wife is murdered, a man drifts into a world populated by thugs and speed junkies.

Name: The Savages
Credit: Dir: Tamara Jenkins With: Laura Linney, Philip Seymour Hoffman, Philip Bosco
Outline: A sister and brother face the realities of familial responsibility as they begin to care for their ailing father.

Name: Shooter
Credit: Dir: Antoine Fuqua With: Mark Wahlberg, Michael PeÃ±a, Rhona Mitra
Outline: A marksman living in exile is coaxed back into action after learning of a plot to kill the President. Ultimately double-crossed and framed for the attempt, he goes on the run to find the real killer and the reason he was set up.

Name: Shakespeare in Love
Credit: Dir: John Madden With: Gwyneth Paltrow, Joseph Fiennes, Geoffrey Rush
Outline: A young Shakespeare, out of ideas and short of cash, meets his ideal woman and is inspired to write one of his most famous plays.

Name: The Outsiders
Credit: Dir: Francis Ford Coppola With: C. Thomas Howell, Matt Dillon, Ralph Macchio
Outline: The rivalry between two gangs, the poor greasers and the rich Socs, only heats up when one gang member kills a member of the other.

Name: The Full Monty
Credit: Dir: Peter Cattaneo With: Robert Carlyle, Tom Wilkinson, Mark Addy
Outline: Six unemployed steel workers form a male striptease act. The women cheer them on to go for "the full monty" - total nudity.

Name: Remember Me
Credit: Dir: Allen Coulter With: Robert Pattinson, Emilie de Ravin, Caitlyn Rund
Outline: A romantic drama centered on two new lovers: Tyler, whose parents have split in the wake of his brother's suicide, and Ally, who lives each day to the fullest since witnessing her mother's murder.

Name: I Am Legend
Credit: Dir: Francis Lawrence With: Will Smith, Alice Braga, Charlie Tahan
Outline: Years after a plague kills most of humanity and transforms the rest into monsters, the sole survivor in New York City struggles valiantly to find a cure.

Name: Born on the Fourth of July
Credit: Dir: Oliver Stone With: Tom Cruise, Raymond J. Barry, Caroline Kava
Outline: The biography of Ron Kovic. Paralyzed in the Vietnam war, he becomes an anti-war and pro-human rights political activist after feeling betrayed by the country he fought for.

Name: Never Let Me Go
Credit: Dir: Mark Romanek With: Keira Knightley, Carey Mulligan, Andrew Garfield
Outline: The lives of three friends, from their early school days into young adulthood.

Name: Let Me In
Credit: Dir: Matt Reeves With: Kodi Smit-McPhee, ChloÃ« Grace Moretz, Richard Jenkins
Outline: A bullied young boy befriends a young female vampire who lives in secrecy with her guardian.

Name: A League of Their Own
Credit: Dir: Penny Marshall With: Tom Hanks, Geena Davis, Lori Petty
Outline: Two sisters join the first female professional baseball league and struggle to help it succeed amidst their own growing rivalry.

Name: The Kings of Summer
Credit: Dir: Jordan Vogt-Roberts With: Nick Robinson, Gabriel Basso, Moises Arias
Outline: Three teenage friends, in the ultimate act of independence, decide to spend their summer building a house in the woods and living off the land.

Name: Win Win
Credit: Dir: Tom McCarthy With: Paul Giamatti, Amy Ryan, Jeffrey Tambor
Outline: A struggling lawyer and volunteer wrestling coach's chicanery comes back to haunt him when the teenage grandson of the client he has double-crossed comes into his life.

Name: About Schmidt
Credit: Dir: Alexander Payne With: Jack Nicholson, Hope Davis, Dermot Mulroney
Outline: A man upon retirement embarks on a journey to his estranged daughter's wedding only to discover more about himself and life than he ever expected.

Name: Unbroken
Credit: Dir: Angelina Jolie With: Jack O'Connell, Miyavi, Domhnall Gleeson

Name: Carnage

Credit: Dir: Yann Demange With: Jack O'Connell, Sam Reid, Sean Harris
Outline: In 1971, a young and disorientated British soldier is accidentally abandoned by his unit following a riot on the deadly streets of Belfast.

Name: Nowhere Boy
Credit: Dir: Sam Taylor-Johnson With: Aaron Taylor-Johnson, Kristin Scott Thomas, Anne-Marie Duff

Name: Strange Days

Outline: A former cop turned street-hustler accidentally uncovers a police conspiracy in Los Angeles in 1999.

Name: Men of Honor

Name: The Messenger
Credit: Dir: Oren Moverman With: Ben Foster, Samantha Morton, Woody Harrelson
Outline: An American soldier struggles with an ethical dilemma when he becomes involved with a widow of a fallen officer.

Name: White Oleander
Credit: Dir: Peter Kosminsky With: Michelle Pfeiffer, RenÃ©e Zellweger, Robin Wright
Outline: A teenager journeys through a series of foster homes after her mother goes to prison for committing a crime of passion.

Name: Lilo & Stitch
Genre: Animation | Adventure | Comedy | Drama | Family | Fantasy | Music | Sci-Fi
Credit: Dir: Dean DeBlois, Chris Sanders With: Daveigh Chase, Chris Sanders, Tia Carrere
Outline: A Hawaiian girl adopts an unusual pet who is actually a notorious extra-terrestrial fugitive from the law.

Name: Last Tango in Paris
Credit: Dir: Bernardo Bertolucci With: Marlon Brando, Maria Schneider, Maria Michi
Outline: A young Parisian woman meets a middle-aged American businessman who demands their clandestine relationship be based only on sex.

Name: The Lobster
Credit: Dir: Yorgos Lanthimos With: Jacqueline Abrahams, Roger Ashton-Griffiths, Jessica Barden

Name: Rocky II
Credit: Dir: Sylvester Stallone With: Sylvester Stallone, Talia Shire, Burt Young
Outline: Rocky struggles in family life after his bout with Apollo Creed, while the embarrassed champ insistently goads him to accept a challenge for a rematch.

Name: Everybody's Fine
Credit: Dir: Kirk Jones With: Robert De Niro, Kate Beckinsale, Sam Rockwell
Outline: A widower who realized his only connection to his family was through his wife sets off on an impromptu road trip to reunite with each of his grown children.

Name: It's Kind of a Funny Story
Credit: Dir: Anna Boden, Ryan Fleck With: Keir Gilchrist, Zach Galifianakis, Emma Roberts
Outline: A clinically depressed teenager gets a new start after he checks himself into an adult psychiatric ward.

Name: Vicky Cristina Barcelona
Credit: Dir: Woody Allen With: Rebecca Hall, Scarlett Johansson, Javier Bardem
Outline: Two girlfriends on a summer holiday in Spain become enamored with the same painter, unaware that his ex-wife, with whom he has a tempestuous relationship, is about to re-enter the picture.

Name: Lee Daniels' The Butler
Credit: Dir: Lee Daniels With: Forest Whitaker, Oprah Winfrey, John Cusack
Outline: As Cecil Gaines serves eight presidents during his tenure as a butler at the White House, the civil rights movement, Vietnam, and other major events affect this man's life, family, and American society.

Name: Kill the Irishman
Credit: Dir: Jonathan Hensleigh With: Ray Stevenson, Christopher Walken, Vincent D'Onofrio
Outline: The true story of Danny Greene, a tough Irish thug working for mobsters in Cleveland during the 1970's.

Name: Pay It Forward
Credit: Dir: Mimi Leder With: Kevin Spacey, Haley Joel Osment, Helen Hunt
Outline: A young boy attempts to make the world a better place after his teacher gives him that chance.

Name: Three Kings
Credit: Dir: David O. Russell With: George Clooney, Mark Wahlberg, Ice Cube
Outline: In the aftermath of the Persian Gulf War, 4 soldiers set out to steal gold that was stolen from Kuwait, but they discover people who desperately need their help.

Name: Definitely, Maybe
Credit: Dir: Adam Brooks With: Ryan Reynolds, Rachel Weisz, Abigail Breslin
Outline: A political consultant tries to explain his impending divorce and past relationships to his 11-year-old daughter.

Name: Wild
Credit: Dir: Jean-Marc VallÃ©e With: Reese Witherspoon, Laura Dern, Gaby Hoffmann
Outline: A chronicle of one woman's 1,100-mile solo hike undertaken as a way to recover from a recent personal tragedy.

Name: The Girl Who Played with Fire
Credit: Dir: Daniel Alfredson With: Noomi Rapace, Michael Nyqvist, Lena Endre
Outline: As computer hacker Lisbeth and journalist Mikael investigate a sex-trafficking ring, Lisbeth is accused of three murders, causing her to go on the run while Mikael works to clear her name.

Name: We Were Soldiers
Credit: Dir: Randall Wallace With: Mel Gibson, Madeleine Stowe, Greg Kinnear
Outline: The story of the first major battle of the American phase of the Vietnam War and the soldiers on both sides that fought it.

Name: Hard Candy
Credit: Dir: David Slade With: Patrick Wilson, Ellen Page, Sandra Oh
Outline: A teenage girl raids a man's home in order to expose him under suspicion that he is a sex offender with pedophilia (not to be confused with a person who suffers the condition of pedophilia).

Name: The Spectacular Now
Credit: Dir: James Ponsoldt With: Miles Teller, Shailene Woodley, Kyle Chandler
Outline: A hard-partying high school senior's philosophy on life changes when he meets the not-so-typical "nice girl."

Name: Angel-A
Credit: Dir: Luc Besson With: Rie Rasmussen, Jamel Debbouze, Gilbert Melki
Outline: A beautiful woman helps an inept scam artist get his game together.

Name: Margin Call
Credit: Dir: J.C. Chandor With: Zachary Quinto, Stanley Tucci, Kevin Spacey
Outline: Follows the key people at an investment bank, over a 24-hour period, during the early stages of the financial crisis.

Name: The Legend Is Born: Ip Man
Credit: Dir: Herman Yau With: Yu-Hang To, Yi Huang, Biao Yuen
Outline: Yip Man's resistance against invading foreigners, along with his romantic relations while under the tutelage of three Wing Chun masters.

Name: The Passion of the Christ
Credit: Dir: Mel Gibson With: Jim Caviezel, Monica Bellucci, Maia Morgenstern
Outline: Depicts the final twelve hours in the life of Jesus of Nazareth, on the day of his crucifixion in Jerusalem.

Name: Moonstruck
Credit: Dir: Norman Jewison With: Cher, Nicolas Cage, Olympia Dukakis
Outline: Loretta Castorini, a book keeper from Brooklyn, New York, finds herself in a difficult situation when she falls for the brother of the man she has agreed to marry.

Name: Wag the Dog
Credit: Dir: Barry Levinson With: Dustin Hoffman, Robert De Niro, Anne Heche
Outline: Shortly before an election, a spin-doctor and a Hollywood producer join efforts to fabricate a war in order to cover up a presidential sex scandal.

Name: The Patriot
Credit: Dir: Roland Emmerich With: Mel Gibson, Heath Ledger, Joely Richardson
Outline: Peaceful farmer Benjamin Martin is driven to lead the Colonial Militia during the American Revolution when a sadistic British officer murders his son.

Name: Bitter Moon
Credit: Dir: Roman Polanski With: Hugh Grant, Kristin Scott Thomas, Emmanuelle Seigner
Outline: British couple Fiona and Nigel Dobson are sailing to Istanbul en route to India. They encounter a beautiful French woman...

Name: State of Play
Credit: Dir: Kevin Macdonald With: Russell Crowe, Rachel McAdams, Ben Affleck
Outline: When a congressional aide is killed, a Washington D.C. journalist starts investigating the case involving the congressman, his old college friend.

Name: The Ides of March
Credit: Dir: George Clooney With: Paul Giamatti, George Clooney, Philip Seymour Hoffman
Outline: An idealistic staffer for a new presidential candidate gets a crash course on dirty politics during his stint on the campaign trail.

Name: Meet Joe Black
Credit: Dir: Martin Brest With: Brad Pitt, Anthony Hopkins, Claire Forlani
Outline: Death, who takes the form of a young man, asks a media mogul to act as a guide to teach him about life on Earth and in the process he falls in love with his guide's daughter.

Name: The Jacket
Credit: Dir: John Maybury With: Adrien Brody, Keira Knightley, Daniel Craig
Outline: A Gulf war veteran is wrongly sent to a mental institution for insane criminals, where he becomes the object of a Doctor's experiments, and his life is completely affected by them.

Name: Far from the Madding Crowd

Outline: In Victorian England, the independent and headstrong Bathsheba Everdene attracts three very different suitors: Gabriel Oak, a sheep farmer; Frank Troy, a reckless Sergeant; and William Boldwood, a prosperous and mature bachelor.

Name: A.I. Artificial Intelligence

Outline: A highly advanced robotic boy longs to become "real" so that he can regain the love of his human mother.

Name: Valkyrie

Name: The Devil's Double

Name: Brothers
Credit: Dir: Jim Sheridan With: Jake Gyllenhaal, Natalie Portman, Tobey Maguire
Outline: A young man comforts his older brother's wife and children after he goes missing in Afghanistan.

Name: Melancholia
Credit: Dir: Lars von Trier With: Kirsten Dunst, Charlotte Gainsbourg, Kiefer Sutherland
Outline: Two sisters find their already strained relationship challenged as a mysterious new planet threatens to collide with Earth.

Name: The Protector
Credit: Dir: Prachya Pinkaew With: Tony Jaa, Nathan Jones, Petchtai Wongkamlao

Name: Body of Lies
Credit: Dir: Ridley Scott With: Leonardo DiCaprio, Russell Crowe, Mark Strong
Outline: A CIA agent on the ground in Jordan hunts down a powerful terrorist leader while being caught between the unclear intentions of his American supervisors and Jordan Intelligence.

Name: Sneakers
Credit: Dir: Phil Alden Robinson With: Robert Redford, Dan Aykroyd, Sidney Poitier
Outline: A security pro finds his past coming back to haunt him, when he and his unique team are tasked with retrieving a particularly important item.

Name: Bad Santa

Name: Unthinkable
Credit: Dir: Gregor Jordan With: Samuel L. Jackson, Carrie-Anne Moss, Michael Sheen
Outline: A psychological thriller centered around a black-ops interrogator and an FBI agent who press a suspect terrorist into divulging the location of three nuclear weapons set to detonate in the U.S.

Name: Blue Ruin
Credit: Dir: Jeremy Saulnier With: Macon Blair, Devin Ratray, Amy Hargreaves

Name: Concussion

Outline: In Pittsburgh, accomplished pathologist Dr. Bennet Omalu uncovers the truth about brain damage in football players who suffer repeated concussions in the course of normal play.

Name: Bronson

Name: Kinsey

Name: We Bought a Zoo

Outline: Set in Southern California, a father moves his young family to the countryside to renovate and re-open a struggling zoo.

Name: Locke

Name: Rab Ne Bana Di Jodi

Outline: A middle-aged man who lost his love for life rediscovers it by assuming a new identity in order to rekindle the romantic spark in his marriage.

Name: Ichi the Killer
Genre: Action | Comedy | Crime | Drama | Horror | Thriller
Credit: Dir: Takashi Miike With: Tadanobu Asano, Nao Ãmori, Shin'ya Tsukamoto
Outline: As sadomasochistic yakuza enforcer Kakihara searches for his missing boss he comes across Ichi, a repressed and psychotic killer who may be able to inflict levels of pain that Kakihara has only dreamed of.

Name: Lords of Dogtown
Credit: Dir: Catherine Hardwicke With: Heath Ledger, Emile Hirsch, Victor Rasuk
Outline: The film follows the surf and skateboarding trends that originated in Venice, California during the 1970's.

Name: Bad Lieutenant
Credit: Dir: Abel Ferrara With: Harvey Keitel, Victor Argo, Paul Calderon
Outline: While investigating a young nun's rape, a corrupt New York City police detective, with a serious drug and gambling addiction, tries to change his ways and find forgiveness.

Name: The Water Diviner
Credit: Dir: Russell Crowe With: Russell Crowe, Olga Kurylenko, Jai Courtney
Outline: An Australian man travels to Turkey after the Battle of Gallipoli to try and locate his three missing sons.

Name: Becoming Jane
Credit: Dir: Julian Jarrold With: Anne Hathaway, James McAvoy, Julie Walters
Outline: A biographical portrait of a pre-fame Jane Austen and her romance with a young Irishman.

Name: Anastasia
Genre: Animation | Adventure | Drama | Family | Fantasy | Musical | Mystery | Romance
Credit: Dir: Don Bluth, Gary Goldman With: Meg Ryan, John Cusack, Christopher Lloyd
Outline: The last surviving child of the Russian Royal Family joins two con men to reunite with her grandmother, the Dowager Empress, while the undead Rasputin seeks her death.

Name: The Time Traveler's Wife
Credit: Dir: Robert Schwentke With: Eric Bana, Rachel McAdams, Ron Livingston
Outline: A romantic drama about a Chicago librarian with a gene that causes him to involuntarily time travel, and the complications it creates for his marriage.

Name: Charlie Wilson's War

Name: The Longest Ride

Name: My Own Private Idaho

Name: The Railway Man
Credit: Dir: Jonathan Teplitzky With: Colin Firth, Nicole Kidman, Stellan SkarsgÃ¥rd

Name: Perfect Sense
Credit: Dir: David Mackenzie With: Ewan McGregor, Eva Green, Lauren Tempany
Outline: A chef and a scientist fall in love as an epidemic begins to rob people of their sensory perceptions.

Name: About a Boy
Credit: Dir: Chris Weitz, Paul Weitz With: Hugh Grant, Nicholas Hoult, Toni Collette
Outline: A cynical, immature young man is taught how to act like a grown-up by a little boy.

Name: Runaway Jury
Credit: Dir: Gary Fleder With: John Cusack, Rachel Weisz, Gene Hackman
Outline: A juror on the inside and a woman on the outside manipulate a court trial involving a major gun manufacturer.

Name: Robot & Frank
Credit: Dir: Jake Schreier With: Peter Sarsgaard, Frank Langella, Susan Sarandon
Outline: Set in the near future, an ex-jewel thief receives a gift from his son: a robot butler programmed to look after him. But soon the two companions try their luck as a heist team.

Name: Everest
Credit: Dir: Baltasar KormÃ¡kur With: Jason Clarke, Ang Phula Sherpa, Thomas M. Wright
Outline: A climbing expedition on Mt. Everest is devastated by a severe snow storm.

Name: Away We Go
Credit: Dir: Sam Mendes With: John Krasinski, Maya Rudolph, Allison Janney
Outline: A couple who is expecting their first child travel around the U.S. in order to find a perfect place to start their family. Along the way, they have misadventures and find fresh connections with an assortment of relatives and old friends who just might help them discover "home" on their own terms for the first time.

Name: People Like Us
Credit: Dir: Alex Kurtzman With: Chris Pine, Elizabeth Banks, Michelle Pfeiffer
Outline: While settling his recently deceased father's estate, a salesman discovers he has a sister whom he never knew about, leading both siblings to re-examine their perceptions about family and life choices.

Name: Bottle Rocket
Credit: Dir: Wes Anderson With: Luke Wilson, Owen Wilson, Ned Dowd
Outline: Focusing on a trio of friends and their elaborate plan to pull off a simple robbery and go on the run.

Name: Soul Surfer
Credit: Dir: Sean McNamara With: AnnaSophia Robb, Dennis Quaid, Helen Hunt
Outline: Teenage surfer Bethany Hamilton overcomes the odds and her own fears of returning to the water after losing her left arm in a shark attack.

Name: No Way Out
Genre: Action | Crime | Drama | Mystery | Romance | Thriller
Credit: Dir: Roger Donaldson With: Kevin Costner, Gene Hackman, Sean Young
Outline: A coverup and witchhunt occur after a politician accidentally kills his mistress.

Name: Brotherhood of the Wolf
Credit: Dir: Christophe Gans With: Samuel Le Bihan, Mark Dacascos, JÃ©rÃ©mie Renier
Outline: In 18th century France, the Chevalier de Fronsac and his native American friend Mani are sent by the King to the Gevaudan province to investigate the killings of hundreds by a mysterious beast.

Name: Monster's Ball

Outline: After a family tragedy, a racist prison guard reexamines his attitudes while falling in love with the African American wife of the last prisoner he executed.

Name: Flags of Our Fathers
Credit: Dir: Clint Eastwood With: Ryan Phillippe, Barry Pepper, Joseph Cross

Name: The Rainmaker
Credit: Dir: Francis Ford Coppola With: Matt Damon, Danny DeVito, Claire Danes
Outline: An underdog lawyer takes on a fraudulent Insurance company.

Name: Confessions of a Dangerous Mind
Genre: Biography | Comedy | Crime | Drama | Romance | Thriller
Credit: Dir: George Clooney With: Sam Rockwell, Drew Barrymore, George Clooney
Outline: An adaptation of the cult memoir of game show impresario Chuck Barris, in which he purports to have been a CIA hitman.

Name: We Are Marshall
Credit: Dir: McG With: Matthew McConaughey, Matthew Fox, Anthony Mackie
Outline: When a plane crash claims the lives of members of the Marshall University football team and some of its fans, the team's new coach and his surviving players try to keep the football program alive.

Name: The Merchant of Venice
Credit: Dir: Michael Radford With: Al Pacino, Joseph Fiennes, Lynn Collins
Outline: In 16th century Venice, when a merchant must default on a large loan from an abused Jewish moneylender for a friend with romantic ambitions, the bitterly vengeful creditor demands a gruesome payment instead.

Name: Side Effects
Credit: Dir: Steven Soderbergh With: Rooney Mara, Channing Tatum, Jude Law
Outline: A young woman's world unravels when a drug prescribed by her psychiatrist has unexpected side effects.

Name: Real Steel
Credit: Dir: Shawn Levy With: Hugh Jackman, Evangeline Lilly, Dakota Goyo
Outline: In the near future, robot boxing is a top sport. A struggling promoter feels he's found a champion in a discarded robot.

Name: The Master

Name: Naked Lunch

Name: The Lookout

Name: The Drop
Credit: Dir: MichaÃ«l R. Roskam With: Tom Hardy, Noomi Rapace, James Gandolfini
Outline: Bob Saginowski finds himself at the center of a robbery gone awry and entwined in an investigation that digs deep into the neighborhood's past where friends, families, and foes all work together to make a living - no matter the cost.

Name: Invincible
Credit: Dir: Ericson Core With: Mark Wahlberg, Greg Kinnear, Elizabeth Banks

Name: Payback
Credit: Dir: Brian Helgeland With: Mel Gibson, Gregg Henry, Maria Bello
Outline: Porter is shot by his wife and best friend and is left to die. When he survives he plots revenge.

Name: The Poseidon Adventure
Credit: Dir: Ronald Neame With: Gene Hackman, Ernest Borgnine, Shelley Winters
Outline: A group of passengers struggle to survive and escape when their ocean liner completely capsizes at sea.

Name: Hesher
Credit: Dir: Spencer Susser With: Joseph Gordon-Levitt, Devin Brochu, Natalie Portman
Outline: A young boy has lost his mother and is losing touch with his father and the world around him. Then he meets Hesher who manages to make his life even more chaotic.

Genre: Animation | Action | Adventure | Drama | Mystery | Sci-Fi | Thriller
Credit: Dir: Shane Acker With: Elijah Wood, Jennifer Connelly, Crispin Glover
Outline: A rag doll that awakens in a postapocalyptic future holds the key to humanity's salvation.

Name: Marley & Me
Credit: Dir: David Frankel With: Owen Wilson, Jennifer Aniston, Eric Dane
Outline: A family learns important life lessons from their adorable, but naughty and neurotic dog.

Name: Holes
Credit: Dir: Andrew Davis With: Shia LaBeouf, Sigourney Weaver, Jon Voight

Name: Four Weddings and a Funeral

Name: Secretary

Name: Coffee and Cigarettes
Credit: Dir: Jim Jarmusch With: Bill Murray, Tom Waits, Roberto Benigni
Outline: A series of vignettes that all have coffee and cigarettes in common.

Name: The Words
Credit: Dir: Brian Klugman, Lee Sternthal With: Bradley Cooper, Dennis Quaid, Olivia Wilde
Outline: A writer at the peak of his literary success discovers the steep price he must pay for stealing another man's work.

Name: Find Me Guilty
Credit: Dir: Sidney Lumet With: Vin Diesel, Peter Dinklage, Ron Silver
Outline: Based on the true story of Jack DiNorscio, a mobster who defended himself in court for what would be the longest mafia trial in U.S. history.

Name: Balto

Outline: An outcast half-wolf risks his life to prevent a deadly epidemic from ravaging Nome, Alaska.

Name: Enough Said
Credit: Dir: Nicole Holofcener With: Julia Louis-Dreyfus, James Gandolfini, Catherine Keener
Outline: A divorced woman who decides to pursue the man she's interested in learns he's her new friend's ex-husband.

Name: Tinker Tailor Soldier Spy
Credit: Dir: Tomas Alfredson With: Gary Oldman, Colin Firth, Tom Hardy
Outline: In the bleak days of the Cold War, espionage veteran George Smiley is forced from semi-retirement to uncover a Soviet agent within MI6.

Name: The Kids Are All Right
Credit: Dir: Lisa Cholodenko With: Annette Bening, Julianne Moore, Mark Ruffalo

Name: Bone Tomahawk
Credit: Dir: S. Craig Zahler With: Kurt Russell, Patrick Wilson, Matthew Fox

Name: Filth
Credit: Dir: Jon S. Baird With: James McAvoy, Jamie Bell, Eddie Marsan

Name: Holy Motors
Credit: Dir: Leos Carax With: Denis Lavant, Edith Scob, Eva Mendes

Name: Waitress
Credit: Dir: Adrienne Shelly With: Keri Russell, Nathan Fillion, Jeremy Sisto

Name: Chronicle

Name: The Kingdom

Outline: A team of U.S. government agents is sent to investigate the bombing of an American facility in the Middle East.

Name: Casualties of War
Credit: Dir: Brian De Palma With: Michael J. Fox, Sean Penn, Don Harvey
Outline: During the Vietnam War, a soldier finds himself the outsider of his own squad when they unnecessarily kidnap a female villager.

Name: Two Lovers
Credit: Dir: James Gray With: Joaquin Phoenix, Gwyneth Paltrow, Vinessa Shaw
Outline: A Brooklyn-set romantic drama about a bachelor torn between the family friend his parents wish he would marry and his beautiful but volatile new neighbor.

Name: Jarhead

Name: P.S. I Love You

Outline: A young widow discovers that her late husband has left her 10 messages intended to help ease her pain and start a new life.

Name: Million Dollar Arm
Credit: Dir: Craig Gillespie With: Jon Hamm, Aasif Mandvi, Alan Arkin
Outline: A sports agent stages an unconventional recruitment strategy to get talented Indian cricket players to play Major League Baseball.

Name: Out of Sight
Credit: Dir: Steven Soderbergh With: George Clooney, Jennifer Lopez, Ving Rhames
Outline: A career bank robber breaks out of jail and shares a moment of mutual attraction with a US Marshall he has kidnapped.

Name: Alive
Credit: Dir: Frank Marshall With: Ethan Hawke, Vincent Spano, Josh Hamilton
Outline: Uruguayan rugby team stranded in the snow swept Andes are forced to use desperate measures to survive after a plane crash.

Name: Son of Rambow
Credit: Dir: Garth Jennings With: Bill Milner, Will Poulter, Jessica Hynes

Name: A Most Violent Year

Name: John Q

Name: Rent

Name: Bobby

Name: Breach

Name: The Wackness

Name: Unleashed
Credit: Dir: Louis Leterrier With: Jet Li, Bob Hoskins, Morgan Freeman
Outline: A man enslaved by the mob since childhood and raised into behaving like a human attack dog escapes his captors and attempts to start a new life.

Name: Tigerland

Name: Snowpiercer

Outline: Set in a future where a failed climate-change experiment kills all life on the planet except for a lucky few who boarded the Snowpiercer, a train that travels around the globe, where a class system emerges.

Name: Notting Hill
Credit: Dir: Roger Michell With: Hugh Grant, Julia Roberts, Richard McCabe
Outline: The life of a simple bookshop owner changes when he meets the most famous film star in the world.

Name: Wicker Park
Credit: Dir: Paul McGuigan With: Josh Hartnett, Diane Kruger, Matthew Lillard
Outline: A young Chicago advertising executive believes a woman he sees in a cafÃ© is his long-lost love. His belief leads to obsession, as he puts his life on hold in order to trail her.

Name: Bully
Credit: Dir: Larry Clark With: Brad Renfro, Nick Stahl, Bijou Phillips
Outline: A pack of naÃ¯ve teenagers conspire to murder a mutual friend, whose aggressive demeanor has proved too much.

Name: Igby Goes Down
Credit: Dir: Burr Steers With: Kieran Culkin, Susan Sarandon, Jeff Goldblum
Outline: A young man's peculiar upbringing renders him unable to competently cope with the struggle of growing up.

Name: A Serious Man
Credit: Dir: Ethan Coen, Joel Coen With: Michael Stuhlbarg, Richard Kind, Sari Lennick
Outline: Larry Gopnik, a Midwestern physics teacher, watches his life unravel over multiple sudden incidents. Though seeking meaning and answers amidst his turmoils, he seems to keep sinking.

Name: Happy-Go-Lucky
Credit: Dir: Mike Leigh With: Sally Hawkins, Alexis Zegerman, Samuel Roukin
Outline: A look at a few chapters in the life of Poppy, a cheery, colorful, North London schoolteacher whose optimism tends to exasperate those around her.

Name: Charlie Bartlett
Credit: Dir: Jon Poll With: Anton Yelchin, Robert Downey Jr., Hope Davis
Outline: A rich kid becomes the self-appointed psychiatrist to the student body of his new high school.

Name: The Host

Outline: A fictitious love story loosely inspired by the lives of Danish artists Lili Elbe and Gerda Wegener. Lili and Gerda's marriage and work evolve as they navigate Lili's groundbreaking journey as a transgender pioneer.

Name: Rabbit Hole
Credit: Dir: John Cameron Mitchell With: Nicole Kidman, Aaron Eckhart, Dianne Wiest
Outline: Life for a happy couple is turned upside down after their young son dies in an accident.

Name: Kids
Credit: Dir: Larry Clark With: Leo Fitzpatrick, Justin Pierce, ChloÃ« Sevigny
Outline: A day in the life of a group of teens as they travel around New York City skating, drinking, smoking, and deflowering virgins.

Name: Safety Not Guaranteed
Credit: Dir: Colin Trevorrow With: Aubrey Plaza, Mark Duplass, Jake Johnson
Outline: Three magazine employees head out on an assignment to interview a guy who placed a classified advertisement seeking a companion for time travel.

Name: Traitor

Outline: When straight arrow FBI agent Roy Clayton heads up the investigation into a dangerous international conspiracy, all clues seem to lead back to former U.S. Special Operations officer, Samir Horn.

Name: Black Snake Moan

Name: Curse of the Golden Flower

Name: Seven Years in Tibet
